ItemTooltips.quelling_blade: This will help you with last hitting and later on, jungling. If you're taking a ring first, make sure to buy this later.
ItemTooltips.ring_of_protection: Pick this up if you expect a lot of harass in your lane. Later builds into tranquils.
ItemTooltips.stout_shield: Get one of these if you're expecting a lot of physical harass.
ItemTooltips.travel_boots: Boots of Travel let you splitpush much more easily.
ItemTooltips.power_treads: After 6.79 you should get Treads instead of Tranqs.
ItemTooltips.hand_of_midas: Hand of Midas allows you to increase your farm and get more levels, faster.
ItemTooltips.poor_mans_shield: SITUATIONAL: You can get this if you got a Stout Shield at the start. It provides additional protection as well as a nice bit of AGI.
ItemTooltips.vladmir: Vladmir's Offering allows you to jungle early if the lane isn't going well, as well as providing sustain. Don't get both a Drum and a Vlad's.
ItemTooltips.assault: Can be picked up to increase illusion's tankiness.
ItemTooltips.heart: A Heart gives your illusions much more tankiness and allow PL to quickly rejoin a fight with his increased HP regeneration.
ItemTooltips.black_king_bar: More necessary this time around, as PL is now more often than not with his illusions. He's also a lot squishier, so having a BKB helps.
ItemTooltips.sphere: Can be used against heroes with long single-target disables.
ItemTooltips.rapier: Illusions don't get flat damage increase. (But you can still buy it to show off!)
ItemTooltips.monkey_king_bar: This only gives your illusions True Strike, not bashes or extra damage. Build against evasive heroes like Brewmaster, Phantom Assassin, or anyone who would build a butterfly.
ItemTooltips.radiance: Your illusions only get the +45 damage fire tick, and for this much money you're much better off buying something that increases your damage or survivability more.
ItemTooltips.butterfly: Your illusions also get the dodge chance, so they become a lot harder to kill.
ItemTooltips.greater_crit: While illusions do benefit from the critical hit chance, they don't get the flat damage increase. Build this as your last item.
ItemTooltips.bfury: No cleave for your illusions, I'm afraid.
ItemTooltips.manta: A Manta Style gives you a lot more splitpushing and teamfight capabilities by allowing you to kickstart your illusion production. Note that Manta/Illusion runes don't count towards Juxtapose, so this allows you to have 10 illusions.
ItemTooltips.sange_and_yasha: Illusions can't use Sange's maim. Use that Yasha for a Manta instead.
ItemTooltips.skadi: You can replace your Diffusal Blade with this as a final item.
ItemTooltips.diffusal_blade: A diffusal is your first main pickup. The mana burn orb effect works on illusions, so you're hitting a lot harder. The active can be used to chase people down or to kill summons such as Warlock's golems.
ItemTooltips.soul_ring: SITUATIONAL: A Soul Ring is a great pickup if you want to harass or possibly kill enemies in your lane. Don't pick this up if you're farming uncontested.
ItemTooltips.ancient_janggo: SITUATIONAL: Drum isn't as powerful as it used to be, but can still be picked up if you feel you need extra stats.
ItemTooltips.medallion_of_courage: SITUATIONAL: Can be picked up after Diffusal Blade if you're looking to fight early.
ItemTooltips.abyssal_blade: Allows you to lock down sneaky targets.
ItemTooltips.ring_of_aquila: The aura this item gives doesn't help your illusions much. Build a Drum instead.
ItemTooltips.tranquil_boots: Tranquil boots will give you a lot of extra sustain, allowing you to farm and jungle more easily
